intro: Streptopus chatterjeeanus, commonly known as the Chatterjee's starwort, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the temperate regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a umbel, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
